definition: to correct/to rectify/to redress/strong/brave/to pretend/to feign/affectation
to make/to build/to manufacture/to invent/to fabricate/to go to/party (in a lawsuit or legal agreement)/crop/classifier for crops
to do/to grow/to write or compose/to pretend/to regard as/to feel/writings or works

sentences.english: Pure is in one kind of bone thing, installs only can call affectedly .
sentences.chinese: 純真是一種骨子裏的東西，裝出來的只能叫矯揉造作。

sentences.english: They mince and prim and pout.
sentences.chinese: 她們矯揉造作，一本正經還撅着嘴。

sentences.english: Affectation is inevitably the mark of one not sure of himself.
sentences.chinese: 矯揉造作不可避免的會暴露不能肯定自己的人。

sentences.english: She is sincere and quite without affectation.
It runs the risk of coming off as painfully contrived.
sentences.chinese: 風險在於，它會變得矯揉造作，讓人難受。

sentences.english: What I advise him to do is (to) write without affectation.
sentences.chinese: 我建議他做的就是不矯揉造作地寫作。

sentences.english: In 1, his song and mellow, no affectation.
sentences.chinese: 他的歌聲嘹亮圓潤，絲毫沒有矯揉造作之感。

sentences.english: Nothing is too weepy or melodramatic in her performance here.
sentences.chinese: 而她的表演中卻絲毫沒有矯揉造作或是過於浮誇之感。

sentences.english: Who would have thought this clown female caused her appearance to be uglier affectedly.
sentences.chinese: 哪知這醜女的矯揉造作使她樣子更難看了。

sentences.english: Even if there is to do out of affectation .
sentences.chinese: 即使有，也是矯揉造作做出來的。

definition: lit. one body two sides (idiom)/fig. a situation with two sides to it
to choose what is good and hold fast to it (idiom)
attempting nothing and accomplishing nothing (idiom); without any initiative or drive/feckless
see 拔苗助長|拔苗助长[ba2 miao2 zhu4 zhang3]
(of a person) sad beyond words (idiom)/(of music, literature etc) poignant/very sentimental
lit. draw legs on a snake (idiom); fig. to ruin the effect by adding sth superfluous/to overdo it
to force someone to do something
